column1: Morshansk (Russian: Морша́нск) is a town in Tambov Oblast
column3: located on the Tsna River (Oka's basin) 93 kilometers (58 mi) north of Tambov. Population: 41

column1: The exact origins of Morshansk are unknown; however
column2: documents mention a populated place in this location since at least the 16th century. Formerly a village called Morsha (Морша)
column3: it was granted town status in 1779 by Catherine the Great because of its growth in relation to the fact that it was a major bread trading center on the Tsna River.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Morshansk serves as the administrative center of Morshansky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of oblast significance of Morshansk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of oblast significance of Morshansk is incorporated as Morshansk Urban Okrug.
